00001 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00002 // File: DXUTsound.cpp
00003 //
00004 // Desc: DirectSound framework classes for reading and writing wav files and
00005 //       playing them in DirectSound buffers. Feel free to use this class
00006 //       as a starting point for adding extra functionality.

00039 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00040 // Name: CSoundManager::Initialize()
00041 // Desc: Initializes the IDirectSound object and also sets the primary buffer
00042 //       format.  This function must be called before any others.
00043 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00044 HRESULT CSoundManager::Initialize( HWND  hWnd,
00045                                    DWORD dwCoopLevel )
00046 {
00047     HRESULT             hr;
00048 
00049     SAFE_RELEASE( m_pDS );
00050 
00051     // Create IDirectSound using the primary sound device
00052     if( FAILED( hr = DirectSoundCreate8( NULL, &m_pDS, NULL ) ) )
00053         return DXUT_ERR( L"DirectSoundCreate8", hr );
00054 
00055     // Set DirectSound coop level
00056     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->SetCooperativeLevel( hWnd, dwCoopLevel ) ) )
00057         return DXUT_ERR( L"SetCooperativeLevel", hr );
00058 
00059     return S_OK;
00060 }
00061 
00062 
00063 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 // Name: CSoundManager::SetPrimaryBufferFormat()
00065 // Desc: Set primary buffer to a specified format
00066 //       !WARNING! - Setting the primary buffer format and then using this
00067 //                   same DirectSound object for DirectMusic messes up
00068 //                   DirectMusic!
00069 //       For example, to set the primary buffer format to 22kHz stereo, 16-bit
00070 //       then:   dwPrimaryChannels = 2
00071 //               dwPrimaryFreq     = 22050,
00072 //               dwPrimaryBitRate  = 16
00073 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00074 HRESULT CSoundManager::SetPrimaryBufferFormat( DWORD dwPrimaryChannels,
00075                                                DWORD dwPrimaryFreq,
00076                                                DWORD dwPrimaryBitRate )
00077 {
00078     HRESULT             hr;
00079     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSBPrimary = NULL;
00080 
00081     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00082         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00083 
00084     // Get the primary buffer
00085     DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00086     ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00087     dsbd.dwSize        = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00088     dsbd.dwFlags       = DSBCAPS_PRIMARYBUFFER;
00089     dsbd.dwBufferBytes = 0;
00090     dsbd.lpwfxFormat   = NULL;
00091 
00092     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &pDSBPrimary, NULL ) ) )
00093         return DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00094 
00095     WAVEFORMATEX wfx;
00096     ZeroMemory( &wfx, sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX) );
00097     wfx.wFormatTag      = (WORD) WAVE_FORMAT_PCM;
00098     wfx.nChannels       = (WORD) dwPrimaryChannels;
00099     wfx.nSamplesPerSec  = (DWORD) dwPrimaryFreq;
00100     wfx.wBitsPerSample  = (WORD) dwPrimaryBitRate;
00101     wfx.nBlockAlign     = (WORD) (wfx.wBitsPerSample / 8 * wfx.nChannels);
00102     wfx.nAvgBytesPerSec = (DWORD) (wfx.nSamplesPerSec * wfx.nBlockAlign);
00103 
00104     if( FAILED( hr = pDSBPrimary->SetFormat(&wfx) ) )
00105         return DXUT_ERR( L"SetFormat", hr );
00106 
00107     SAFE_RELEASE( pDSBPrimary );
00108 
00109     return S_OK;
00110 }
00111

00113 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00114 // Name: CSoundManager::Get3DListenerInterface()
00115 // Desc: Returns the 3D listener interface associated with primary buffer.
00116 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00117 HRESULT CSoundManager::Get3DListenerInterface( LPDIRECTSOUND3DLISTENER* ppDSListener )
00118 {
00119     HRESULT             hr;
00120     DSBUFFERDESC        dsbdesc;
00121     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSBPrimary = NULL;
00122 
00123     if( ppDSListener == NULL )
00124         return E_INVALIDARG;
00125     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00126         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00127 
00128     *ppDSListener = NULL;
00129 
00130     // Obtain primary buffer, asking it for 3D control
00131     ZeroMemory( &dsbdesc, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00132     dsbdesc.dwSize = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00133     dsbdesc.dwFlags = DSBCAPS_CTRL3D | DSBCAPS_PRIMARYBUFFER;
00134     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbdesc, &pDSBPrimary, NULL ) ) )
00135         return DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00136 
00137     if( FAILED( hr = pDSBPrimary->QueryInterface( IID_IDirectSound3DListener,
00138                                                   (VOID**)ppDSListener ) ) )
00139     {
00140         SAFE_RELEASE( pDSBPrimary );
00141         return DXUT_ERR( L"QueryInterface", hr );
00142     }
00143 
00144     // Release the primary buffer, since it is not need anymore
00145     SAFE_RELEASE( pDSBPrimary );
00146 
00147     return S_OK;
00148 }

00151 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00152 // Name: CSoundManager::Create()
00153 // Desc:
00154 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00155 HRESULT CSoundManager::Create( CSound** ppSound,
00156                                LPWSTR strWaveFileName,
00157                                DWORD dwCreationFlags,
00158                                GUID guid3DAlgorithm,
00159                                DWORD dwNumBuffers )
00160 {
00161     HRESULT hr;
00162     HRESULT hrRet = S_OK;
00163     DWORD   i;
00164     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER* apDSBuffer     = NULL;
00165     DWORD                dwDSBufferSize = NULL;
00166     CWaveFile*           pWaveFile      = NULL;
00167 
00168     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00169         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00170     if( strWaveFileName == NULL || ppSound == NULL || dwNumBuffers < 1 )
00171         return E_INVALIDARG;
00172 
00173     apDSBuffer = new LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER[dwNumBuffers];
00174     if( apDSBuffer == NULL )
00175     {
00176         hr = E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00177         goto LFail;
00178     }
00179 
00180     pWaveFile = new CWaveFile();
00181     if( pWaveFile == NULL )
00182     {
00183         hr = E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00184         goto LFail;
00185     }
00186 
00187     pWaveFile->Open( strWaveFileName, NULL, WAVEFILE_READ );
00188 
00189     if( pWaveFile->GetSize() == 0 )
00190     {
00191         // Wave is blank, so don't create it.
00192         hr = E_FAIL;
00193         goto LFail;
00194     }
00195 
00196     // Make the DirectSound buffer the same size as the wav file
00197     dwDSBufferSize = pWaveFile->GetSize();
00198 
00199     // Create the direct sound buffer, and only request the flags needed
00200     // since each requires some overhead and limits if the buffer can
00201     // be hardware accelerated
00202     DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00203     ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00204     dsbd.dwSize          = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00205     dsbd.dwFlags         = dwCreationFlags;
00206     dsbd.dwBufferBytes   = dwDSBufferSize;
00207     dsbd.guid3DAlgorithm = guid3DAlgorithm;
00208     dsbd.lpwfxFormat     = pWaveFile->m_pwfx;
00209 
00210     // DirectSound is only guarenteed to play PCM data.  Other
00211     // formats may or may not work depending the sound card driver.
00212     hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &apDSBuffer[0], NULL );
00213 
00214     // Be sure to return this error code if it occurs so the
00215     // callers knows this happened.
00216     if( hr == DS_NO_VIRTUALIZATION )
00217         hrRet = DS_NO_VIRTUALIZATION;
00218 
00219     if( FAILED(hr) )
00220     {
00221         // DSERR_BUFFERTOOSMALL will be returned if the buffer is
00222         // less than DSBSIZE_FX_MIN and the buffer is created
00223         // with DSBCAPS_CTRLFX.
00224 
00225         // It might also fail if hardware buffer mixing was requested
00226         // on a device that doesn't support it.
00227         DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00228 
00229         goto LFail;
00230     }
00231 
00232     // Default to use DuplicateSoundBuffer() when created extra buffers since always
00233     // create a buffer that uses the same memory however DuplicateSoundBuffer() will fail if
00234     // DSBCAPS_CTRLFX is used, so use CreateSoundBuffer() instead in this case.
00235     if( (dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLFX) == 0 )
00236     {
00237         for( i=1; i<dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00238         {
00239             if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->DuplicateSoundBuffer( apDSBuffer[0], &apDSBuffer[i] ) ) )
00240             {
00241                 DXUT_ERR( L"DuplicateSoundBuffer", hr );
00242                 goto LFail;
00243             }
00244         }
00245     }
00246     else
00247     {
00248         for( i=1; i<dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00249         {
00250             hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &apDSBuffer[i], NULL );
00251             if( FAILED(hr) )
00252             {
00253                 DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00254                 goto LFail;
00255             }
00256         }
00257    }
00258 
00259     // Create the sound
00260     *ppSound = new CSound( apDSBuffer, dwDSBufferSize, dwNumBuffers, pWaveFile, dwCreationFlags );
00261 
00262     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( apDSBuffer );
00263     return hrRet;
00264 
00265 LFail:
00266     // Cleanup
00267     SAFE_DELETE( pWaveFile );
00268     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( apDSBuffer );
00269     return hr;
00270 }
00271

00273 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00274 // Name: CSoundManager::CreateFromMemory()
00275 // Desc:
00276 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00277 HRESULT CSoundManager::CreateFromMemory( CSound** ppSound,
00278                                         BYTE* pbData,
00279                                         ULONG  ulDataSize,
00280                                         LPWAVEFORMATEX pwfx,
00281                                         DWORD dwCreationFlags,
00282                                         GUID guid3DAlgorithm,
00283                                         DWORD dwNumBuffers )
00284 {
00285     HRESULT hr;
00286     DWORD   i;
00287     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER* apDSBuffer     = NULL;
00288     DWORD                dwDSBufferSize = NULL;
00289     CWaveFile*           pWaveFile      = NULL;
00290 
00291     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00292         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00293     if( pbData == NULL || ppSound == NULL || dwNumBuffers < 1 )
00294         return E_INVALIDARG;
00295 
00296     apDSBuffer = new LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER[dwNumBuffers];
00297     if( apDSBuffer == NULL )
00298     {
00299         hr = E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00300         goto LFail;
00301     }
00302 
00303     pWaveFile = new CWaveFile();
00304     if( pWaveFile == NULL )
00305     {
00306         hr = E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00307         goto LFail;
00308     }
00309 
00310     pWaveFile->OpenFromMemory( pbData,ulDataSize, pwfx, WAVEFILE_READ );
00311 
00312 
00313     // Make the DirectSound buffer the same size as the wav file
00314     dwDSBufferSize = ulDataSize;
00315 
00316     // Create the direct sound buffer, and only request the flags needed
00317     // since each requires some overhead and limits if the buffer can
00318     // be hardware accelerated
00319     DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00320     ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00321     dsbd.dwSize          = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00322     dsbd.dwFlags         = dwCreationFlags;
00323     dsbd.dwBufferBytes   = dwDSBufferSize;
00324     dsbd.guid3DAlgorithm = guid3DAlgorithm;
00325     dsbd.lpwfxFormat     = pwfx;
00326 
00327     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &apDSBuffer[0], NULL ) ) )
00328     {
00329         DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00330         goto LFail;
00331     }
00332 
00333     // Default to use DuplicateSoundBuffer() when created extra buffers since always
00334     // create a buffer that uses the same memory however DuplicateSoundBuffer() will fail if
00335     // DSBCAPS_CTRLFX is used, so use CreateSoundBuffer() instead in this case.
00336     if( (dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLFX) == 0 )
00337     {
00338         for( i=1; i<dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00339         {
00340             if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->DuplicateSoundBuffer( apDSBuffer[0], &apDSBuffer[i] ) ) )
00341             {
00342                 DXUT_ERR( L"DuplicateSoundBuffer", hr );
00343                 goto LFail;
00344             }
00345         }
00346     }
00347     else
00348     {
00349         for( i=1; i<dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00350         {
00351             hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &apDSBuffer[i], NULL );
00352             if( FAILED(hr) )
00353             {
00354                 DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00355                 goto LFail;
00356             }
00357         }
00358    }
00359 
00360     // Create the sound
00361     *ppSound = new CSound( apDSBuffer, dwDSBufferSize, dwNumBuffers, pWaveFile, dwCreationFlags );
00362 
00363     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( apDSBuffer );
00364     return S_OK;
00365 
00366 LFail:
00367     // Cleanup
00368 
00369     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( apDSBuffer );
00370     return hr;
00371 }

00374 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00375 // Name: CSoundManager::CreateStreaming()
00376 // Desc:
00377 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00378 HRESULT CSoundManager::CreateStreaming( CStreamingSound** ppStreamingSound,
00379                                         LPWSTR strWaveFileName,
00380                                         DWORD dwCreationFlags,
00381                                         GUID guid3DAlgorithm,
00382                                         DWORD dwNotifyCount,
00383                                         DWORD dwNotifySize,
00384                                         HANDLE hNotifyEvent )
00385 {
00386     HRESULT hr;
00387 
00388     if( m_pDS == NULL )
00389         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00390     if( strWaveFileName == NULL || ppStreamingSound == NULL || hNotifyEvent == NULL )
00391         return E_INVALIDARG;
00392 
00393     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSBuffer      = NULL;
00394     DWORD               dwDSBufferSize = NULL;
00395     CWaveFile*          pWaveFile      = NULL;
00396     DSBPOSITIONNOTIFY*  aPosNotify     = NULL;
00397     LPDIRECTSOUNDNOTIFY pDSNotify      = NULL;
00398 
00399     pWaveFile = new CWaveFile();
00400     if( pWaveFile == NULL )
00401         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00402     pWaveFile->Open( strWaveFileName, NULL, WAVEFILE_READ );
00403 
00404     // Figure out how big the DirectSound buffer should be
00405     dwDSBufferSize = dwNotifySize * dwNotifyCount;
00406 
00407     // Set up the direct sound buffer.  Request the NOTIFY flag, so
00408     // that we are notified as the sound buffer plays.  Note, that using this flag
00409     // may limit the amount of hardware acceleration that can occur.
00410     DSBUFFERDESC dsbd;
00411     ZeroMemory( &dsbd, sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC) );
00412     dsbd.dwSize          = sizeof(DSBUFFERDESC);
00413     dsbd.dwFlags         = dwCreationFlags |
00414                            DSBCAPS_CTRLPOSITIONNOTIFY |
00415                            DSBCAPS_GETCURRENTPOSITION2;
00416     dsbd.dwBufferBytes   = dwDSBufferSize;
00417     dsbd.guid3DAlgorithm = guid3DAlgorithm;
00418     dsbd.lpwfxFormat     = pWaveFile->m_pwfx;
00419 
00420     if( FAILED( hr = m_pDS->CreateSoundBuffer( &dsbd, &pDSBuffer, NULL ) ) )
00421     {
00422         // If wave format isn't then it will return
00423         // either DSERR_BADFORMAT or E_INVALIDARG
00424         if( hr == DSERR_BADFORMAT || hr == E_INVALIDARG )
00425             return DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00426 
00427         return DXUT_ERR( L"CreateSoundBuffer", hr );
00428     }
00429 
00430     // Create the notification events, so that we know when to fill
00431     // the buffer as the sound plays.
00432     if( FAILED( hr = pDSBuffer->QueryInterface( IID_IDirectSoundNotify,
00433                                                 (VOID**)&pDSNotify ) ) )
00434     {
00435         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( aPosNotify );
00436         return DXUT_ERR( L"QueryInterface", hr );
00437     }
00438 
00439     aPosNotify = new DSBPOSITIONNOTIFY[ dwNotifyCount ];
00440     if( aPosNotify == NULL )
00441         return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00442 
00443     for( DWORD i = 0; i < dwNotifyCount; i++ )
00444     {
00445         aPosNotify[i].dwOffset     = (dwNotifySize * i) + dwNotifySize - 1;
00446         aPosNotify[i].hEventNotify = hNotifyEvent;
00447     }
00448 
00449     // Tell DirectSound when to notify us. The notification will come in the from
00450     // of signaled events that are handled in WinMain()
00451     if( FAILED( hr = pDSNotify->SetNotificationPositions( dwNotifyCount,
00452                                                           aPosNotify ) ) )
00453     {
00454         SAFE_RELEASE( pDSNotify );
00455         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( aPosNotify );
00456         return DXUT_ERR( L"SetNotificationPositions", hr );
00457     }
00458 
00459     SAFE_RELEASE( pDSNotify );
00460     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( aPosNotify );
00461 
00462     // Create the sound
00463     *ppStreamingSound = new CStreamingSound( pDSBuffer, dwDSBufferSize, pWaveFile, dwNotifySize );
00464 
00465     return S_OK;
00466 }

00469 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00470 // Name: CSound::CSound()
00471 // Desc: Constructs the class
00472 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00473 CSound::CSound( LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER* apDSBuffer, DWORD dwDSBufferSize,
00474                 DWORD dwNumBuffers, CWaveFile* pWaveFile, DWORD dwCreationFlags )
00475 {
00476     DWORD i;
00477 
00478     if( dwNumBuffers <= 0 )
00479         return;
00480 
00481     m_apDSBuffer = new LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER[dwNumBuffers];
00482     if( NULL != m_apDSBuffer )
00483     {
00484         for( i=0; i<dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00485             m_apDSBuffer[i] = apDSBuffer[i];
00486 
00487         m_dwDSBufferSize = dwDSBufferSize;
00488         m_dwNumBuffers   = dwNumBuffers;
00489         m_pWaveFile      = pWaveFile;
00490         m_dwCreationFlags = dwCreationFlags;
00491 
00492         FillBufferWithSound( m_apDSBuffer[0], FALSE );
00493     }
00494 }
00495

00497 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00498 // Name: CSound::~CSound()
00499 // Desc: Destroys the class
00500 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00501 CSound::~CSound()
00502 {
00503     for( DWORD i=0; i<m_dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00504     {
00505         SAFE_RELEASE( m_apDSBuffer[i] );
00506     }
00507 
00508     SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( m_apDSBuffer );
00509     SAFE_DELETE( m_pWaveFile );
00510 }

00512 
00513 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00514 // Name: CSound::FillBufferWithSound()
00515 // Desc: Fills a DirectSound buffer with a sound file
00516 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00517 HRESULT CSound::FillBufferWithSound( LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB, BOOL bRepeatWavIfBufferLarger )
00518 {
00519     HRESULT hr;
00520     VOID*   pDSLockedBuffer      = NULL; // Pointer to locked buffer memory
00521     DWORD   dwDSLockedBufferSize = 0;    // Size of the locked DirectSound buffer
00522     DWORD   dwWavDataRead        = 0;    // Amount of data read from the wav file
00523 
00524     if( pDSB == NULL )
00525         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00526 
00527     // Make sure we have focus, and we didn't just switch in from
00528     // an app which had a DirectSound device
00529     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( pDSB, NULL ) ) )
00530         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
00531 
00532     // Lock the buffer down
00533     if( FAILED( hr = pDSB->Lock( 0, m_dwDSBufferSize,
00534                                  &pDSLockedBuffer, &dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00535                                  NULL, NULL, 0L ) ) )
00536         return DXUT_ERR( L"Lock", hr );
00537 
00538     // Reset the wave file to the beginning
00539     m_pWaveFile->ResetFile();
00540 
00541     if( FAILED( hr = m_pWaveFile->Read( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer,
00542                                         dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00543                                         &dwWavDataRead ) ) )
00544         return DXUT_ERR( L"Read", hr );
00545 
00546     if( dwWavDataRead == 0 )
00547     {
00548         // Wav is blank, so just fill with silence
00549         FillMemory( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer,
00550                     dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00551                     (BYTE)(m_pWaveFile->m_pwfx->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00552     }
00553     else if( dwWavDataRead < dwDSLockedBufferSize )
00554     {
00555         // If the wav file was smaller than the DirectSound buffer,
00556         // we need to fill the remainder of the buffer with data
00557         if( bRepeatWavIfBufferLarger )
00558         {
00559             // Reset the file and fill the buffer with wav data
00560             DWORD dwReadSoFar = dwWavDataRead;    // From previous call above.
00561             while( dwReadSoFar < dwDSLockedBufferSize )
00562             {
00563                 // This will keep reading in until the buffer is full
00564                 // for very short files
00565                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pWaveFile->ResetFile() ) )
00566                     return DXUT_ERR( L"ResetFile", hr );
00567 
00568                 hr = m_pWaveFile->Read( (BYTE*)pDSLockedBuffer + dwReadSoFar,
00569                                         dwDSLockedBufferSize - dwReadSoFar,
00570                                         &dwWavDataRead );
00571                 if( FAILED(hr) )
00572                     return DXUT_ERR( L"Read", hr );
00573 
00574                 dwReadSoFar += dwWavDataRead;
00575             }
00576         }
00577         else
00578         {
00579             // Don't repeat the wav file, just fill in silence
00580             FillMemory( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer + dwWavDataRead,
00581                         dwDSLockedBufferSize - dwWavDataRead,
00582                         (BYTE)(m_pWaveFile->m_pwfx->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00583         }
00584     }
00585 
00586     // Unlock the buffer, we don't need it anymore.
00587     pDSB->Unlock( pDSLockedBuffer, dwDSLockedBufferSize, NULL, 0 );
00588 
00589     return S_OK;
00590 }
00591 
00592 
00593 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00594 // Name: CSound::RestoreBuffer()
00595 // Desc: Restores the lost buffer. *pbWasRestored returns TRUE if the buffer was
00596 //       restored.  It can also NULL if the information is not needed.
00597 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00598 HRESULT CSound::RestoreBuffer( LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB, BOOL* pbWasRestored )
00599 {
00600     HRESULT hr;
00601 
00602     if( pDSB == NULL )
00603         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00604     if( pbWasRestored )
00605         *pbWasRestored = FALSE;
00606 
00607     DWORD dwStatus;
00608     if( FAILED( hr = pDSB->GetStatus( &dwStatus ) ) )
00609         return DXUT_ERR( L"GetStatus", hr );
00610 
00611     if( dwStatus & DSBSTATUS_BUFFERLOST )
00612     {
00613         // Since the app could have just been activated, then
00614         // DirectSound may not be giving us control yet, so
00615         // the restoring the buffer may fail.
00616         // If it does, sleep until DirectSound gives us control.
00617         do
00618         {
00619             hr = pDSB->Restore();
00620             if( hr == DSERR_BUFFERLOST )
00621                 Sleep( 10 );
00622         }
00623         while( ( hr = pDSB->Restore() ) == DSERR_BUFFERLOST );
00624 
00625         if( pbWasRestored != NULL )
00626             *pbWasRestored = TRUE;
00627 
00628         return S_OK;
00629     }
00630     else
00631     {
00632         return S_FALSE;
00633     }
00634 }
00635 
00636 
00637 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00638 // Name: CSound::GetFreeBuffer()
00639 // Desc: Finding the first buffer that is not playing and return a pointer to
00640 //       it, or if all are playing return a pointer to a randomly selected buffer.
00641 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00642 LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER CSound::GetFreeBuffer()
00643 {
00644     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00645         return FALSE;
00646 
00647         DWORD i;
00648     for( i=0; i<m_dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00649     {
00650         if( m_apDSBuffer[i] )
00651         {
00652             DWORD dwStatus = 0;
00653             m_apDSBuffer[i]->GetStatus( &dwStatus );
00654             if ( ( dwStatus & DSBSTATUS_PLAYING ) == 0 )
00655                 break;
00656         }
00657     }
00658 
00659     if( i != m_dwNumBuffers )
00660         return m_apDSBuffer[ i ];
00661     else
00662         return m_apDSBuffer[ rand() % m_dwNumBuffers ];
00663 }
00664 
00665 
00666 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00667 // Name: CSound::GetBuffer()
00668 // Desc:
00669 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00670 LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER CSound::GetBuffer( DWORD dwIndex )
00671 {
00672     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00673         return NULL;
00674     if( dwIndex >= m_dwNumBuffers )
00675         return NULL;
00676 
00677     return m_apDSBuffer[dwIndex];
00678 }
00679 
00680 
00681 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00682 // Name: CSound::Get3DBufferInterface()
00683 // Desc:
00684 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00685 HRESULT CSound::Get3DBufferInterface( DWORD dwIndex, LPDIRECTSOUND3DBUFFER* ppDS3DBuffer )
00686 {
00687     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00688         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00689     if( dwIndex >= m_dwNumBuffers )
00690         return E_INVALIDARG;
00691 
00692     *ppDS3DBuffer = NULL;
00693 
00694     return m_apDSBuffer[dwIndex]->QueryInterface( IID_IDirectSound3DBuffer,
00695                                                   (VOID**)ppDS3DBuffer );
00696 }
00697 
00698 
00699 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00700 // Name: CSound::Play()
00701 // Desc: Plays the sound using voice management flags.  Pass in DSBPLAY_LOOPING
00702 //       in the dwFlags to loop the sound
00703 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00704 HRESULT CSound::Play( DWORD dwPriority, DWORD dwFlags, LONG lVolume, LONG lFrequency, LONG lPan )
00705 {
00706     HRESULT hr;
00707     BOOL    bRestored;
00708 
00709     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00710         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00711 
00712     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = GetFreeBuffer();
00713 
00714     if( pDSB == NULL )
00715         return DXUT_ERR( L"GetFreeBuffer", E_FAIL );
00716 
00717     // Restore the buffer if it was lost
00718     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( pDSB, &bRestored ) ) )
00719         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
00720 
00721     if( bRestored )
00722     {
00723         // The buffer was restored, so we need to fill it with new data
00724         if( FAILED( hr = FillBufferWithSound( pDSB, FALSE ) ) )
00725             return DXUT_ERR( L"FillBufferWithSound", hr );
00726     }
00727 
00728     if( m_dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLVOLUME )
00729     {
00730         pDSB->SetVolume( lVolume );
00731     }
00732 
00733     if( lFrequency != -1 &&
00734         (m_dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLFREQUENCY) )
00735     {
00736         pDSB->SetFrequency( lFrequency );
00737     }
00738 
00739     if( m_dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLPAN )
00740     {
00741         pDSB->SetPan( lPan );
00742     }
00743 
00744     return pDSB->Play( 0, dwPriority, dwFlags );
00745 }
00746 
00747 
00748 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00749 // Name: CSound::Play3D()
00750 // Desc: Plays the sound using voice management flags.  Pass in DSBPLAY_LOOPING
00751 //       in the dwFlags to loop the sound
00752 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00753 HRESULT CSound::Play3D( LPDS3DBUFFER p3DBuffer, DWORD dwPriority, DWORD dwFlags, LONG lFrequency )
00754 {
00755     HRESULT hr;
00756     BOOL    bRestored;
00757     DWORD   dwBaseFrequency;
00758 
00759     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00760         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00761 
00762     LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSB = GetFreeBuffer();
00763     if( pDSB == NULL )
00764         return DXUT_ERR( L"GetFreeBuffer", E_FAIL );
00765 
00766     // Restore the buffer if it was lost
00767     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( pDSB, &bRestored ) ) )
00768         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
00769 
00770     if( bRestored )
00771     {
00772         // The buffer was restored, so we need to fill it with new data
00773         if( FAILED( hr = FillBufferWithSound( pDSB, FALSE ) ) )
00774             return DXUT_ERR( L"FillBufferWithSound", hr );
00775     }
00776 
00777     if( m_dwCreationFlags & DSBCAPS_CTRLFREQUENCY )
00778     {
00779         pDSB->GetFrequency( &dwBaseFrequency );
00780         pDSB->SetFrequency( dwBaseFrequency + lFrequency );
00781     }
00782 
00783     // QI for the 3D buffer
00784     LPDIRECTSOUND3DBUFFER pDS3DBuffer;
00785     hr = pDSB->QueryInterface( IID_IDirectSound3DBuffer, (VOID**) &pDS3DBuffer );
00786     if( SUCCEEDED( hr ) )
00787     {
00788         hr = pDS3DBuffer->SetAllParameters( p3DBuffer, DS3D_IMMEDIATE );
00789         if( SUCCEEDED( hr ) )
00790         {
00791             hr = pDSB->Play( 0, dwPriority, dwFlags );
00792         }
00793 
00794         pDS3DBuffer->Release();
00795     }
00796 
00797     return hr;
00798 }
00799 
00800 
00801 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00802 // Name: CSound::Stop()
00803 // Desc: Stops the sound from playing
00804 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00805 HRESULT CSound::Stop()
00806 {
00807     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00808         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00809 
00810     HRESULT hr = 0;
00811 
00812     for( DWORD i=0; i<m_dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00813         hr |= m_apDSBuffer[i]->Stop();
00814 
00815     return hr;
00816 }
00817 
00818 
00819 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00820 // Name: CSound::Reset()
00821 // Desc: Reset all of the sound buffers
00822 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00823 HRESULT CSound::Reset()
00824 {
00825     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00826         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00827 
00828     HRESULT hr = 0;
00829 
00830     for( DWORD i=0; i<m_dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00831         hr |= m_apDSBuffer[i]->SetCurrentPosition( 0 );
00832 
00833     return hr;
00834 }
00835 
00836 
00837 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00838 // Name: CSound::IsSoundPlaying()
00839 // Desc: Checks to see if a buffer is playing and returns TRUE if it is.
00840 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00841 BOOL CSound::IsSoundPlaying()
00842 {
00843     BOOL bIsPlaying = FALSE;
00844 
00845     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL )
00846         return FALSE;
00847 
00848     for( DWORD i=0; i<m_dwNumBuffers; i++ )
00849     {
00850         if( m_apDSBuffer[i] )
00851         {
00852             DWORD dwStatus = 0;
00853             m_apDSBuffer[i]->GetStatus( &dwStatus );
00854             bIsPlaying |= ( ( dwStatus & DSBSTATUS_PLAYING ) != 0 );
00855         }
00856     }
00857 
00858     return bIsPlaying;
00859 }
00860 
00861 
00862 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00863 // Name: CStreamingSound::CStreamingSound()
00864 // Desc: Setups up a buffer so data can be streamed from the wave file into
00865 //       a buffer.  This is very useful for large wav files that would take a
00866 //       while to load.  The buffer is initially filled with data, then
00867 //       as sound is played the notification events are signaled and more data
00868 //       is written into the buffer by calling HandleWaveStreamNotification()
00869 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00870 CStreamingSound::CStreamingSound( LPDIRECTSOUNDBUFFER pDSBuffer, DWORD dwDSBufferSize,
00871                                   CWaveFile* pWaveFile, DWORD dwNotifySize )
00872                 : CSound( &pDSBuffer, dwDSBufferSize, 1, pWaveFile, 0 )
00873 {
00874     m_dwLastPlayPos     = 0;
00875     m_dwPlayProgress    = 0;
00876     m_dwNotifySize      = dwNotifySize;
00877     m_dwNextWriteOffset = 0;
00878     m_bFillNextNotificationWithSilence = FALSE;
00879 }
00880 
00881 
00882 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00883 // Name: CStreamingSound::~CStreamingSound()
00884 // Desc: Destroys the class
00885 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00886 CStreamingSound::~CStreamingSound()
00887 {
00888 }
00889 
00890 
00891 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00892 // Name: CStreamingSound::HandleWaveStreamNotification()
00893 // Desc: Handle the notification that tells us to put more wav data in the
00894 //       circular buffer
00895 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00896 HRESULT CStreamingSound::HandleWaveStreamNotification( BOOL bLoopedPlay )
00897 {
00898     HRESULT hr;
00899     DWORD   dwCurrentPlayPos;
00900     DWORD   dwPlayDelta;
00901     DWORD   dwBytesWrittenToBuffer;
00902     VOID*   pDSLockedBuffer = NULL;
00903     VOID*   pDSLockedBuffer2 = NULL;
00904     DWORD   dwDSLockedBufferSize;
00905     DWORD   dwDSLockedBufferSize2;
00906 
00907     if( m_apDSBuffer == NULL || m_pWaveFile == NULL )
00908         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
00909 
00910     // Restore the buffer if it was lost
00911     BOOL bRestored;
00912     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( m_apDSBuffer[0], &bRestored ) ) )
00913         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
00914 
00915     if( bRestored )
00916     {
00917         // The buffer was restored, so we need to fill it with new data
00918         if( FAILED( hr = FillBufferWithSound( m_apDSBuffer[0], FALSE ) ) )
00919             return DXUT_ERR( L"FillBufferWithSound", hr );
00920         return S_OK;
00921     }
00922 
00923     // Lock the DirectSound buffer
00924     if( FAILED( hr = m_apDSBuffer[0]->Lock( m_dwNextWriteOffset, m_dwNotifySize,
00925                                             &pDSLockedBuffer, &dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00926                                             &pDSLockedBuffer2, &dwDSLockedBufferSize2, 0L ) ) )
00927         return DXUT_ERR( L"Lock", hr );
00928 
00929     // m_dwDSBufferSize and m_dwNextWriteOffset are both multiples of m_dwNotifySize,
00930     // it should the second buffer, so it should never be valid
00931     if( pDSLockedBuffer2 != NULL )
00932         return E_UNEXPECTED;
00933 
00934     if( !m_bFillNextNotificationWithSilence )
00935     {
00936         // Fill the DirectSound buffer with wav data
00937         if( FAILED( hr = m_pWaveFile->Read( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer,
00938                                                   dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00939                                                   &dwBytesWrittenToBuffer ) ) )
00940             return DXUT_ERR( L"Read", hr );
00941     }
00942     else
00943     {
00944         // Fill the DirectSound buffer with silence
00945         FillMemory( pDSLockedBuffer, dwDSLockedBufferSize,
00946                     (BYTE)( m_pWaveFile->m_pwfx->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00947         dwBytesWrittenToBuffer = dwDSLockedBufferSize;
00948     }
00949 
00950     // If the number of bytes written is less than the
00951     // amount we requested, we have a short file.
00952     if( dwBytesWrittenToBuffer < dwDSLockedBufferSize )
00953     {
00954         if( !bLoopedPlay )
00955         {
00956             // Fill in silence for the rest of the buffer.
00957             FillMemory( (BYTE*) pDSLockedBuffer + dwBytesWrittenToBuffer,
00958                         dwDSLockedBufferSize - dwBytesWrittenToBuffer,
00959                         (BYTE)(m_pWaveFile->m_pwfx->wBitsPerSample == 8 ? 128 : 0 ) );
00960 
00961             // Any future notifications should just fill the buffer with silence
00962             m_bFillNextNotificationWithSilence = TRUE;
00963         }
00964         else
00965         {
00966             // We are looping, so reset the file and fill the buffer with wav data
00967             DWORD dwReadSoFar = dwBytesWrittenToBuffer;    // From previous call above.
00968             while( dwReadSoFar < dwDSLockedBufferSize )
00969             {
00970                 // This will keep reading in until the buffer is full (for very short files).
00971                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pWaveFile->ResetFile() ) )
00972                     return DXUT_ERR( L"ResetFile", hr );
00973 
00974                 if( FAILED( hr = m_pWaveFile->Read( (BYTE*)pDSLockedBuffer + dwReadSoFar,
00975                                                           dwDSLockedBufferSize - dwReadSoFar,
00976                                                           &dwBytesWrittenToBuffer ) ) )
00977                     return DXUT_ERR( L"Read", hr );
00978 
00979                 dwReadSoFar += dwBytesWrittenToBuffer;
00980             }
00981         }
00982     }
00983 
00984     // Unlock the DirectSound buffer
00985     m_apDSBuffer[0]->Unlock( pDSLockedBuffer, dwDSLockedBufferSize, NULL, 0 );
00986 
00987     // Figure out how much data has been played so far.  When we have played
00988     // past the end of the file, we will either need to start filling the
00989     // buffer with silence or starting reading from the beginning of the file,
00990     // depending if the user wants to loop the sound
00991     if( FAILED( hr = m_apDSBuffer[0]->GetCurrentPosition( &dwCurrentPlayPos, NULL ) ) )
00992         return DXUT_ERR( L"GetCurrentPosition", hr );
00993 
00994     // Check to see if the position counter looped
00995     if( dwCurrentPlayPos < m_dwLastPlayPos )
00996         dwPlayDelta = ( m_dwDSBufferSize - m_dwLastPlayPos ) + dwCurrentPlayPos;
00997     else
00998         dwPlayDelta = dwCurrentPlayPos - m_dwLastPlayPos;
00999 
01000     m_dwPlayProgress += dwPlayDelta;
01001     m_dwLastPlayPos = dwCurrentPlayPos;
01002 
01003     // If we are now filling the buffer with silence, then we have found the end so
01004     // check to see if the entire sound has played, if it has then stop the buffer.
01005     if( m_bFillNextNotificationWithSilence )
01006     {
01007         // We don't want to cut off the sound before it's done playing.
01008         if( m_dwPlayProgress >= m_pWaveFile->GetSize() )
01009         {
01010             m_apDSBuffer[0]->Stop();
01011         }
01012     }
01013 
01014     // Update where the buffer will lock (for next time)
01015     m_dwNextWriteOffset += dwDSLockedBufferSize;
01016     m_dwNextWriteOffset %= m_dwDSBufferSize; // Circular buffer
01017 
01018     return S_OK;
01019 }
01020 
01021 
01022 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01023 // Name: CStreamingSound::Reset()
01024 // Desc: Resets the sound so it will begin playing at the beginning
01025 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01026 HRESULT CStreamingSound::Reset()
01027 {
01028     HRESULT hr;
01029 
01030     if( m_apDSBuffer[0] == NULL || m_pWaveFile == NULL )
01031         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01032 
01033     m_dwLastPlayPos     = 0;
01034     m_dwPlayProgress    = 0;
01035     m_dwNextWriteOffset = 0;
01036     m_bFillNextNotificationWithSilence = FALSE;
01037 
01038     // Restore the buffer if it was lost
01039     BOOL bRestored;
01040     if( FAILED( hr = RestoreBuffer( m_apDSBuffer[0], &bRestored ) ) )
01041         return DXUT_ERR( L"RestoreBuffer", hr );
01042 
01043     if( bRestored )
01044     {
01045         // The buffer was restored, so we need to fill it with new data
01046         if( FAILED( hr = FillBufferWithSound( m_apDSBuffer[0], FALSE ) ) )
01047             return DXUT_ERR( L"FillBufferWithSound", hr );
01048     }
01049 
01050     m_pWaveFile->ResetFile();
01051 
01052     return m_apDSBuffer[0]->SetCurrentPosition( 0L );
01053 }
01054 
01055 
01056 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01057 // Name: CWaveFile::CWaveFile()
01058 // Desc: Constructs the class.  Call Open() to open a wave file for reading.
01059 //       Then call Read() as needed.  Calling the destructor or Close()
01060 //       will close the file.
01061 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01062 CWaveFile::CWaveFile()
01063 {
01064     m_pwfx    = NULL;
01065     m_hmmio   = NULL;
01066     m_pResourceBuffer = NULL;
01067     m_dwSize  = 0;
01068     m_bIsReadingFromMemory = FALSE;
01069 }
01070 
01071 
01072 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01073 // Name: CWaveFile::~CWaveFile()
01074 // Desc: Destructs the class
01075 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01076 CWaveFile::~CWaveFile()
01077 {
01078     Close();
01079 
01080     if( !m_bIsReadingFromMemory )
01081         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( m_pwfx );
01082 }
01083 
01084 
01085 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01086 // Name: CWaveFile::Open()
01087 // Desc: Opens a wave file for reading
01088 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01089 HRESULT CWaveFile::Open( LPWSTR strFileName, WAVEFORMATEX* pwfx, DWORD dwFlags )
01090 {
01091     HRESULT hr;
01092 
01093     m_dwFlags = dwFlags;
01094     m_bIsReadingFromMemory = FALSE;
01095 
01096     if( m_dwFlags == WAVEFILE_READ )
01097     {
01098         if( strFileName == NULL )
01099             return E_INVALIDARG;
01100         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( m_pwfx );
01101 
01102         m_hmmio = mmioOpen( strFileName, NULL, MMIO_ALLOCBUF | MMIO_READ );
01103 
01104         if( NULL == m_hmmio )
01105         {
01106             HRSRC   hResInfo;
01107             HGLOBAL hResData;
01108             DWORD   dwSize;
01109             VOID*   pvRes;
01110 
01111             // Loading it as a file failed, so try it as a resource
01112             if( NULL == ( hResInfo = FindResource( NULL, strFileName, L"WAVE" ) ) )
01113             {
01114                 if( NULL == ( hResInfo = FindResource( NULL, strFileName, L"WAV" ) ) )
01115                     return DXUT_ERR( L"FindResource", E_FAIL );
01116             }
01117 
01118             if( NULL == ( hResData = LoadResource( GetModuleHandle(NULL), hResInfo ) ) )
01119                 return DXUT_ERR( L"LoadResource", E_FAIL );
01120 
01121             if( 0 == ( dwSize = SizeofResource( GetModuleHandle(NULL), hResInfo ) ) )
01122                 return DXUT_ERR( L"SizeofResource", E_FAIL );
01123 
01124             if( NULL == ( pvRes = LockResource( hResData ) ) )
01125                 return DXUT_ERR( L"LockResource", E_FAIL );
01126 
01127             m_pResourceBuffer = new CHAR[ dwSize ];
01128             if( m_pResourceBuffer == NULL )
01129                 return DXUT_ERR( L"new", E_OUTOFMEMORY );
01130             memcpy( m_pResourceBuffer, pvRes, dwSize );
01131 
01132             MMIOINFO mmioInfo;
01133             ZeroMemory( &mmioInfo, sizeof(mmioInfo) );
01134             mmioInfo.fccIOProc = FOURCC_MEM;
01135             mmioInfo.cchBuffer = dwSize;
01136             mmioInfo.pchBuffer = (CHAR*) m_pResourceBuffer;
01137 
01138             m_hmmio = mmioOpen( NULL, &mmioInfo, MMIO_ALLOCBUF | MMIO_READ );
01139         }
01140 
01141         if( FAILED( hr = ReadMMIO() ) )
01142         {
01143             // ReadMMIO will fail if its an not a wave file
01144             mmioClose( m_hmmio, 0 );
01145             return DXUT_ERR( L"ReadMMIO", hr );
01146         }
01147 
01148         if( FAILED( hr = ResetFile() ) )
01149             return DXUT_ERR( L"ResetFile", hr );
01150 
01151         // After the reset, the size of the wav file is m_ck.cksize so store it now
01152         m_dwSize = m_ck.cksize;
01153     }
01154     else
01155     {
01156         m_hmmio = mmioOpen( strFileName, NULL, MMIO_ALLOCBUF  |
01157                                                   MMIO_READWRITE |
01158                                                   MMIO_CREATE );
01159         if( NULL == m_hmmio )
01160             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioOpen", E_FAIL );
01161 
01162         if( FAILED( hr = WriteMMIO( pwfx ) ) )
01163         {
01164             mmioClose( m_hmmio, 0 );
01165             return DXUT_ERR( L"WriteMMIO", hr );
01166         }
01167 
01168         if( FAILED( hr = ResetFile() ) )
01169             return DXUT_ERR( L"ResetFile", hr );
01170     }
01171 
01172     return hr;
01173 }
01174 
01175 
01176 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01177 // Name: CWaveFile::OpenFromMemory()
01178 // Desc: copy data to CWaveFile member variable from memory
01179 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01180 HRESULT CWaveFile::OpenFromMemory( BYTE* pbData, ULONG ulDataSize,
01181                                    WAVEFORMATEX* pwfx, DWORD dwFlags )
01182 {
01183     m_pwfx       = pwfx;
01184     m_ulDataSize = ulDataSize;
01185     m_pbData     = pbData;
01186     m_pbDataCur  = m_pbData;
01187     m_bIsReadingFromMemory = TRUE;
01188 
01189     if( dwFlags != WAVEFILE_READ )
01190         return E_NOTIMPL;
01191 
01192     return S_OK;
01193 }
01194 
01195 
01196 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01197 // Name: CWaveFile::ReadMMIO()
01198 // Desc: Support function for reading from a multimedia I/O stream.
01199 //       m_hmmio must be valid before calling.  This function uses it to
01200 //       update m_ckRiff, and m_pwfx.
01201 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01202 HRESULT CWaveFile::ReadMMIO()
01203 {
01204     MMCKINFO        ckIn;           // chunk info. for general use.
01205     PCMWAVEFORMAT   pcmWaveFormat;  // Temp PCM structure to load in.
01206 
01207     m_pwfx = NULL;
01208 
01209     if( ( 0 != mmioDescend( m_hmmio, &m_ckRiff, NULL, 0 ) ) )
01210         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioDescend", E_FAIL );
01211 
01212     // Check to make sure this is a valid wave file
01213     if( (m_ckRiff.ckid != FOURCC_RIFF) ||
01214         (m_ckRiff.fccType != mmioFOURCC('W', 'A', 'V', 'E') ) )
01215         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioFOURCC", E_FAIL );
01216 
01217     // Search the input file for for the 'fmt ' chunk.
01218     ckIn.ckid = mmioFOURCC('f', 'm', 't', ' ');
01219     if( 0 != mmioDescend( m_hmmio, &ckIn, &m_ckRiff, MMIO_FINDCHUNK ) )
01220         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioDescend", E_FAIL );
01221 
01222     // Expect the 'fmt' chunk to be at least as large as <PCMWAVEFORMAT>;
01223     // if there are extra parameters at the end, we'll ignore them
01224        if( ckIn.cksize < (LONG) sizeof(PCMWAVEFORMAT) )
01225            return DXUT_ERR( L"sizeof(PCMWAVEFORMAT)", E_FAIL );
01226 
01227     // Read the 'fmt ' chunk into <pcmWaveFormat>.
01228     if( mmioRead( m_hmmio, (HPSTR) &pcmWaveFormat,
01229                   sizeof(pcmWaveFormat)) != sizeof(pcmWaveFormat) )
01230         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioRead", E_FAIL );
01231 
01232     // Allocate the waveformatex, but if its not pcm format, read the next
01233     // word, and thats how many extra bytes to allocate.
01234     if( pcmWaveFormat.wf.wFormatTag == WAVE_FORMAT_PCM )
01235     {
01236         m_pwfx = (WAVEFORMATEX*)new CHAR[ sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX) ];
01237         if( NULL == m_pwfx )
01238             return DXUT_ERR( L"m_pwfx", E_FAIL );
01239 
01240         // Copy the bytes from the pcm structure to the waveformatex structure
01241         memcpy( m_pwfx, &pcmWaveFormat, sizeof(pcmWaveFormat) );
01242         m_pwfx->cbSize = 0;
01243     }
01244     else
01245     {
01246         // Read in length of extra bytes.
01247         WORD cbExtraBytes = 0L;
01248         if( mmioRead( m_hmmio, (CHAR*)&cbExtraBytes, sizeof(WORD)) != sizeof(WORD) )
01249             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioRead", E_FAIL );
01250 
01251         m_pwfx = (WAVEFORMATEX*)new CHAR[ sizeof(WAVEFORMATEX) + cbExtraBytes ];
01252         if( NULL == m_pwfx )
01253             return DXUT_ERR( L"new", E_FAIL );
01254 
01255         // Copy the bytes from the pcm structure to the waveformatex structure
01256         memcpy( m_pwfx, &pcmWaveFormat, sizeof(pcmWaveFormat) );
01257         m_pwfx->cbSize = cbExtraBytes;
01258 
01259         // Now, read those extra bytes into the structure, if cbExtraAlloc != 0.
01260         if( mmioRead( m_hmmio, (CHAR*)(((BYTE*)&(m_pwfx->cbSize))+sizeof(WORD)),
01261                       cbExtraBytes ) != cbExtraBytes )
01262         {
01263             SAFE_DELETE( m_pwfx );
01264             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioRead", E_FAIL );
01265         }
01266     }
01267 
01268     // Ascend the input file out of the 'fmt ' chunk.
01269     if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &ckIn, 0 ) )
01270     {
01271         SAFE_DELETE( m_pwfx );
01272         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01273     }
01274 
01275     return S_OK;
01276 }
01277 
01278 
01279 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01280 // Name: CWaveFile::GetSize()
01281 // Desc: Retuns the size of the read access wave file
01282 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01283 DWORD CWaveFile::GetSize()
01284 {
01285     return m_dwSize;
01286 }
01287 
01288 
01289 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01290 // Name: CWaveFile::ResetFile()
01291 // Desc: Resets the internal m_ck pointer so reading starts from the
01292 //       beginning of the file again
01293 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01294 HRESULT CWaveFile::ResetFile()
01295 {
01296     if( m_bIsReadingFromMemory )
01297     {
01298         m_pbDataCur = m_pbData;
01299     }
01300     else
01301     {
01302         if( m_hmmio == NULL )
01303             return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01304 
01305         if( m_dwFlags == WAVEFILE_READ )
01306         {
01307             // Seek to the data
01308             if( -1 == mmioSeek( m_hmmio, m_ckRiff.dwDataOffset + sizeof(FOURCC),
01309                             SEEK_SET ) )
01310                 return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioSeek", E_FAIL );
01311 
01312             // Search the input file for the 'data' chunk.
01313             m_ck.ckid = mmioFOURCC('d', 'a', 't', 'a');
01314             if( 0 != mmioDescend( m_hmmio, &m_ck, &m_ckRiff, MMIO_FINDCHUNK ) )
01315               return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioDescend", E_FAIL );
01316         }
01317         else
01318         {
01319             // Create the 'data' chunk that holds the waveform samples.
01320             m_ck.ckid = mmioFOURCC('d', 'a', 't', 'a');
01321             m_ck.cksize = 0;
01322 
01323             if( 0 != mmioCreateChunk( m_hmmio, &m_ck, 0 ) )
01324                 return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioCreateChunk", E_FAIL );
01325 
01326             if( 0 != mmioGetInfo( m_hmmio, &m_mmioinfoOut, 0 ) )
01327                 return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioGetInfo", E_FAIL );
01328         }
01329     }
01330 
01331     return S_OK;
01332 }
01333 
01334 
01335 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01336 // Name: CWaveFile::Read()
01337 // Desc: Reads section of data from a wave file into pBuffer and returns
01338 //       how much read in pdwSizeRead, reading not more than dwSizeToRead.
01339 //       This uses m_ck to determine where to start reading from.  So
01340 //       subsequent calls will be continue where the last left off unless
01341 //       Reset() is called.
01342 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01343 HRESULT CWaveFile::Read( BYTE* pBuffer, DWORD dwSizeToRead, DWORD* pdwSizeRead )
01344 {
01345     if( m_bIsReadingFromMemory )
01346     {
01347         if( m_pbDataCur == NULL )
01348             return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01349         if( pdwSizeRead != NULL )
01350             *pdwSizeRead = 0;
01351 
01352         if( (BYTE*)(m_pbDataCur + dwSizeToRead) >
01353             (BYTE*)(m_pbData + m_ulDataSize) )
01354         {
01355             dwSizeToRead = m_ulDataSize - (DWORD)(m_pbDataCur - m_pbData);
01356         }
01357 
01358         CopyMemory( pBuffer, m_pbDataCur, dwSizeToRead );
01359 
01360         if( pdwSizeRead != NULL )
01361             *pdwSizeRead = dwSizeToRead;
01362 
01363         return S_OK;
01364     }
01365     else
01366     {
01367         MMIOINFO mmioinfoIn; // current status of m_hmmio
01368 
01369         if( m_hmmio == NULL )
01370             return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01371         if( pBuffer == NULL || pdwSizeRead == NULL )
01372             return E_INVALIDARG;
01373 
01374         if( pdwSizeRead != NULL )
01375             *pdwSizeRead = 0;
01376 
01377         if( 0 != mmioGetInfo( m_hmmio, &mmioinfoIn, 0 ) )
01378             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioGetInfo", E_FAIL );
01379 
01380         UINT cbDataIn = dwSizeToRead;
01381         if( cbDataIn > m_ck.cksize )
01382             cbDataIn = m_ck.cksize;
01383 
01384         m_ck.cksize -= cbDataIn;
01385 
01386         for( DWORD cT = 0; cT < cbDataIn; cT++ )
01387         {
01388             // Copy the bytes from the io to the buffer.
01389             if( mmioinfoIn.pchNext == mmioinfoIn.pchEndRead )
01390             {
01391                 if( 0 != mmioAdvance( m_hmmio, &mmioinfoIn, MMIO_READ ) )
01392                     return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAdvance", E_FAIL );
01393 
01394                 if( mmioinfoIn.pchNext == mmioinfoIn.pchEndRead )
01395                     return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioinfoIn.pchNext", E_FAIL );
01396             }
01397 
01398             // Actual copy.
01399             *((BYTE*)pBuffer+cT) = *((BYTE*)mmioinfoIn.pchNext);
01400             mmioinfoIn.pchNext++;
01401         }
01402 
01403         if( 0 != mmioSetInfo( m_hmmio, &mmioinfoIn, 0 ) )
01404             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioSetInfo", E_FAIL );
01405 
01406         if( pdwSizeRead != NULL )
01407             *pdwSizeRead = cbDataIn;
01408 
01409         return S_OK;
01410     }
01411 }
01412 
01413 
01414 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01415 // Name: CWaveFile::Close()
01416 // Desc: Closes the wave file
01417 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01418 HRESULT CWaveFile::Close()
01419 {
01420     if( m_dwFlags == WAVEFILE_READ )
01421     {
01422         mmioClose( m_hmmio, 0 );
01423         m_hmmio = NULL;
01424         SAFE_DELETE_ARRAY( m_pResourceBuffer );
01425     }
01426     else
01427     {
01428         m_mmioinfoOut.dwFlags |= MMIO_DIRTY;
01429 
01430         if( m_hmmio == NULL )
01431             return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01432 
01433         if( 0 != mmioSetInfo( m_hmmio, &m_mmioinfoOut, 0 ) )
01434             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioSetInfo", E_FAIL );
01435 
01436         // Ascend the output file out of the 'data' chunk -- this will cause
01437         // the chunk size of the 'data' chunk to be written.
01438         if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &m_ck, 0 ) )
01439             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01440 
01441         // Do this here instead...
01442         if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &m_ckRiff, 0 ) )
01443             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01444 
01445         mmioSeek( m_hmmio, 0, SEEK_SET );
01446 
01447         if( 0 != (INT)mmioDescend( m_hmmio, &m_ckRiff, NULL, 0 ) )
01448             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioDescend", E_FAIL );
01449 
01450         m_ck.ckid = mmioFOURCC('f', 'a', 'c', 't');
01451 
01452         if( 0 == mmioDescend( m_hmmio, &m_ck, &m_ckRiff, MMIO_FINDCHUNK ) )
01453         {
01454             DWORD dwSamples = 0;
01455             mmioWrite( m_hmmio, (HPSTR)&dwSamples, sizeof(DWORD) );
01456             mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &m_ck, 0 );
01457         }
01458 
01459         // Ascend the output file out of the 'RIFF' chunk -- this will cause
01460         // the chunk size of the 'RIFF' chunk to be written.
01461         if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &m_ckRiff, 0 ) )
01462             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01463 
01464         mmioClose( m_hmmio, 0 );
01465         m_hmmio = NULL;
01466     }
01467 
01468     return S_OK;
01469 }
01470 
01471 
01472 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01473 // Name: CWaveFile::WriteMMIO()
01474 // Desc: Support function for reading from a multimedia I/O stream
01475 //       pwfxDest is the WAVEFORMATEX for this new wave file.
01476 //       m_hmmio must be valid before calling.  This function uses it to
01477 //       update m_ckRiff, and m_ck.
01478 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01479 HRESULT CWaveFile::WriteMMIO( WAVEFORMATEX *pwfxDest )
01480 {
01481     DWORD    dwFactChunk; // Contains the actual fact chunk. Garbage until WaveCloseWriteFile.
01482     MMCKINFO ckOut1;
01483 
01484     dwFactChunk = (DWORD)-1;
01485 
01486     // Create the output file RIFF chunk of form type 'WAVE'.
01487     m_ckRiff.fccType = mmioFOURCC('W', 'A', 'V', 'E');
01488     m_ckRiff.cksize = 0;
01489 
01490     if( 0 != mmioCreateChunk( m_hmmio, &m_ckRiff, MMIO_CREATERIFF ) )
01491         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioCreateChunk", E_FAIL );
01492 
01493     // We are now descended into the 'RIFF' chunk we just created.
01494     // Now create the 'fmt ' chunk. Since we know the size of this chunk,
01495     // specify it in the MMCKINFO structure so MMIO doesn't have to seek
01496     // back and set the chunk size after ascending from the chunk.
01497     m_ck.ckid = mmioFOURCC('f', 'm', 't', ' ');
01498     m_ck.cksize = sizeof(PCMWAVEFORMAT);
01499 
01500     if( 0 != mmioCreateChunk( m_hmmio, &m_ck, 0 ) )
01501         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioCreateChunk", E_FAIL );
01502 
01503     // Write the PCMWAVEFORMAT structure to the 'fmt ' chunk if its that type.
01504     if( pwfxDest->wFormatTag == WAVE_FORMAT_PCM )
01505     {
01506         if( mmioWrite( m_hmmio, (HPSTR) pwfxDest,
01507                        sizeof(PCMWAVEFORMAT)) != sizeof(PCMWAVEFORMAT))
01508             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioWrite", E_FAIL );
01509     }
01510     else
01511     {
01512         // Write the variable length size.
01513         if( (UINT)mmioWrite( m_hmmio, (HPSTR) pwfxDest,
01514                              sizeof(*pwfxDest) + pwfxDest->cbSize ) !=
01515                              ( sizeof(*pwfxDest) + pwfxDest->cbSize ) )
01516             return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioWrite", E_FAIL );
01517     }
01518 
01519     // Ascend out of the 'fmt ' chunk, back into the 'RIFF' chunk.
01520     if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &m_ck, 0 ) )
01521         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01522 
01523     // Now create the fact chunk, not required for PCM but nice to have.  This is filled
01524     // in when the close routine is called.
01525     ckOut1.ckid = mmioFOURCC('f', 'a', 'c', 't');
01526     ckOut1.cksize = 0;
01527 
01528     if( 0 != mmioCreateChunk( m_hmmio, &ckOut1, 0 ) )
01529         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioCreateChunk", E_FAIL );
01530 
01531     if( mmioWrite( m_hmmio, (HPSTR)&dwFactChunk, sizeof(dwFactChunk)) !=
01532                     sizeof(dwFactChunk) )
01533          return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioWrite", E_FAIL );
01534 
01535     // Now ascend out of the fact chunk...
01536     if( 0 != mmioAscend( m_hmmio, &ckOut1, 0 ) )
01537         return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAscend", E_FAIL );
01538 
01539     return S_OK;
01540 }
01541 
01542 
01543 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01544 // Name: CWaveFile::Write()
01545 // Desc: Writes data to the open wave file
01546 //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
01547 HRESULT CWaveFile::Write( UINT nSizeToWrite, BYTE* pbSrcData, UINT* pnSizeWrote )
01548 {
01549     UINT cT;
01550 
01551     if( m_bIsReadingFromMemory )
01552         return E_NOTIMPL;
01553     if( m_hmmio == NULL )
01554         return CO_E_NOTINITIALIZED;
01555     if( pnSizeWrote == NULL || pbSrcData == NULL )
01556         return E_INVALIDARG;
01557 
01558     *pnSizeWrote = 0;
01559 
01560     for( cT = 0; cT < nSizeToWrite; cT++ )
01561     {
01562         if( m_mmioinfoOut.pchNext == m_mmioinfoOut.pchEndWrite )
01563         {
01564             m_mmioinfoOut.dwFlags |= MMIO_DIRTY;
01565             if( 0 != mmioAdvance( m_hmmio, &m_mmioinfoOut, MMIO_WRITE ) )
01566                 return DXUT_ERR( L"mmioAdvance", E_FAIL );
01567         }
01568 
01569         *((BYTE*)m_mmioinfoOut.pchNext) = *((BYTE*)pbSrcData+cT);
01570         (BYTE*)m_mmioinfoOut.pchNext++;
01571 
01572         (*pnSizeWrote)++;
01573     }
01574 
01575     return S_OK;
01576 }
